definitions.definition: One who confesses faith in Christianity in the face of persecution , but who is not martyred .
examples: Long before Edward I , the English had a King Edward who they considered a martyr and a King Edward who they considered a confessor .

definitions.definition: One who confesses to having done something wrong.
A priest who hears confession and then gives absolution .
Someone who acts as listener and helper .

main_definition: One who confesses faith in Christianity in the face of persecution , but who is not martyred .
secondary_definitions: One who confesses to having done something wrong.
( Eastern Orthodoxy , Roman Catholicism ) A priest who hears confession and then gives absolution .
( by extension , figurative ) Someone who acts as listener and helper .
